str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Ultimately from a and hupnos; to be sleepless, i.e. Keep awake.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To want for myself; I want, need; I beg, request, beseech, pray. Middle voice of deo; to beg, i.e. Petition.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To prevail against, overpower, get the upper hand. From kata and ischuo; to overpower.
To flee out, away, escape; with an acc: I escape something. From ek and pheugo; to flee out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
